reviewText:
I've seen almost every single movie Quentin Dupieux has made except for his first film, Nonfilm (though I plan to see it!) and I'd say this is up there as one of my favorites! (but all of his films are great in my opinion. haha not perfect, but I personally still really enjoy them)  I recommend anyone unfamiliar with his work that's interested in watching this movie make sure that you watch his movie Rubber first, as I think that's a good test to know whether you're into his style or not.

It's a weird yet subdued comedy, and ends are not tied up, so if you're looking for over the top and everything becoming clear in the end, I would not recommend. haha But if you enjoy things being weird "for no reason" surrounding a bunch of subtle yet very funny moments, then you may enjoy this film.

I like strange movies, but this was ultimately kind of boring and not very funny. I didn't feel the fun sort of confusion I think the filmmaker wanted me to feel; I wasn't interested enough to try to follow along or make sense of things. It wasn't bad, though. One hilarious scene with Eric Wareheim (whose comedic sensibility I found underused).

Also, a good portion of this film is in French with subtitles. Didn't bother me, but I don't see that fact advertised anywhere on Amazon.

My feelings about Reality can be summed up thusly: Had I known this was on Netflix (at the time of this review) I would've watched it there and then not purchased it. However, I don't mind having my own copy. I might give it another try.

The best movies I've watched this year. It blowed my mind. Inception "french" style
Also, the soundtrack is awesome!
Pretty bizarre movie! Not sure I could ever sit through this again.

I have been a big fan of Eric Roberts for some time now, I had the chance to see the movie on it's opening night at Downtown Boca Film Festival, and I loved it!!! lots of babes, different countries, and Eric Roberts is killing it! So I will definitely be one of the first to buy the DVD when it's out!
